identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effect of Hypercapnia on Regional Cerebral Oxygen Saturation in the Sitting Position

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of hypercapnia on hemodynamics and cerebral oxygenation during shoulder arthroscopy.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The patients are randomly allocated to receive normocapnia or hypercapnia . After the 70ยบ sitting position, record the mean arterial pressure (MAP), heart rate, and regional oxygen saturation (rSO2).

armGroups.label: normocapnia
armGroups.description: Tidal volume (10 ml/kg) and respiratory rate is adjusted to achieve the objective values of ETCO2 35mmHg

armGroups.label: hypercapnia
armGroups.description: Tidal volume (6ml/kg) and respiratory rate is adjusted to achieve the objective values of ETCO2 45mmHg

interventions.name: hypercapnia
interventions.description: Tidal volume (6 ml/kg) and respiratory rate is adjusted to achieve the objective values of ETCO2 45mmHg

interventions.name: normocapnia
interventions.description: Tidal volume (10 ml/kg) and respiratory rate is adjusted to achieve the objective values of ETCO2 35mmHg

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from Regional cerebral oxygen saturation at 2,4,6,8,10,20 min after anesthetic induction and sitting position

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* patients undergoing elective shoulder arthroscopic surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

* a history of age \> 65 years, morbidly obesity (BMI \> 30 kg/m2), diffuse lung disease, uncontrolled systemic hypertension, intracranial disease, cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease.

references.citation: Pohl A, Cullen DJ. Cerebral ischemia during shoulder surgery in the upright position: a case series. J Clin Anesth. 2005 Sep;17(6):463-9. doi: 10.1016/j.jclinane.2004.09.012.
